title: Jamie Carragher believes Christian Eriksen is not good enough for Real Madrid
text:
Jamie Carragher insists Christian Eriksen is not good enough to play for Real Madrid and has told the Tottenham midfielder to forget a move to the Spanish giants.

The Denmark international started against Liverpool on Sunday having failed to make the pitch in either of Spurs' last two matches against Watford and Red Star.

With less than 12 months to run on his contract, it appears that the 27-year-old is nearing the end of his north London stay, but Carragher believes he simply isn't good enough to seal the big move he craves.

Jamie Carragher believes Christian Eriksen is not good enough to play for Real Madrid

'Eriksen for me is a really good player for Tottenham , but he keeps getting talked about as this player who could play for Real Madrid. He's not good enough,' said Carragher on Sky Sports.

'If he's that good, he's got a year to go in his contract, you'd pay money for him. People keep saying maybe on a free transfer... you'd have anyone on a free transfer.

'This summer he wanted to go, he made it known, he said it publicly, and no one came in for him.

'I think Eriksen has been fantastic for Spurs but he's not better than Spurs. He might go to PSG, he might go to another club, but he won't make any of them better.'
description: With less than 12 months to run on his contract, it appears that the 27-year-old is nearing the end of his north London stay, but Carragher believes he  isn't good enough to seal the move he craves.
